title: Immanuel
summary: Immanuel (Hebrew: עִמָּנוּאֵל‎ ‘Īmmānū’ēl, meaning, "God is with us"; also romanized: Emmanuel, Imanu'el; also  አማኑኤል ('Amanuel') in Geʽez and Amharic, and Emmanouël or Εμμανουήλ in Koine Greek [Κοινή Ελληνική] language of the New Testament) is a Hebrew name that appears in the Book of Isaiah (7:14) as a sign that God will protect the House of David.[1]
